page.title: 15ECOLOGY 1
page.content: Most of the area is farmed for dairy and beefstock cattle but there are many pockets of currently unmanaged woodland and coppice, old mine work- ings, steep river valleys, and miles of Devon banks and hedgerow which gives an abundance of undisturbed habitat in which wild life can flourish. The mild, wet climate and lack of severe winters also encourages the growth of both animal and plant life. Over the survey area, rabbits, foxes,squirrels,weasels,stoats and the different varieties of rats,mice,voles and shrews can be found in larger numbers. The shyer hedgehogs and moles can also be seen and there is reasonable badger population and occasional feral mink. Frogs, toads and newts use the quieter streams.
